title: 60 Years On, Sheppard Murder Remembered
teaser: David C. Barnett explores the enduring fascination of the murder of Marilyn Sheppard.
contentencoded:
On July 4th, 1954, Marilyn Sheppard, the wife of Dr. Sam Sheppard was murdered in her bed.

Her husband was the primary suspect and the trial became a media sensation, with the nation watching to see the twists and turns of the case.

The Sheppard story subsequently held a place in popular culture. Several books and the TV show “The Fugitive” were based on the unsolved Sheppard murder.

From the Here & Now Contributors Network, David C. Barnett of WCPN takes a look at the ongoing intrigue of this historic case.
